user_request: A Christmas poem about the magic of the season and family togetherness.

revision_history.draft:
The kettle’s whistle cracks the silence—  
a thin, metallic cry.  
You stir the tea,  
fingers tracing the mug’s  
cracked rim,  
where warmth pools  
like forgotten ink.  
The scarf, frayed at the ends,  
drapes over your shoulder—  
a second skin,  
soft as a sigh.  
You hold the gift,  
unwrapped,  
its paper crinkled  
between your palms,  
a weight that isn’t  
anything yet.  
The candle flickers—  
a single flame  
stitching the dark  
to the edge of your breath.

revision_history.draft:
The kettle’s whistle shatters the silence—  
a thin, metallic cry.  
You stir the tea,  
fingers skimming the mug’s  
cracked rim,  
where warmth pools  
like ink forgotten.  
The scarf, frayed at the ends,  
slips over your shoulder—  
a second skin,  
soft as a sigh.  
You hold the gift,  
unwrapped,  
its paper crinkled  
between your palms,  
a weight that hasn’t yet named itself.  
The candle flickers—  
a single flame  
sewing the dark  
to the edge of your breath’s whisper.

The candle flickers—

stitching the dark  
to the edge of your breath’s whisper.

The kettle’s whistle shatters the silence—  
a thin, metallic cry.  
You stir the tea,  
fingers skimming the mug’s  
cracked rim,  
where warmth pools like ink long forgotten.  
The scarf, frayed at the ends,  
drifts over your shoulder—  
a second skin,  
soft as a sigh.  
You hold the gift, unwrapped,  
its paper crinkled  
between your palms,  
a weight unnamed.  
The candle flickers—  
a single flame  
sewing the dark  
to the edge of your breath’s whisper.

final_poem:
The kettle’s whistle slices the silence—  
a thin, metallic cry.  
You stir the tea,  
fingers tracing the mug’s  
cracked rim,  
where warmth pools like ink long forgotten.  
The scarf, frayed at the ends,  
slips over your shoulder—  
a second skin,  
soft as a sigh.  
You hold the gift, unwrapped,  
its paper crinkled  
between your palms,  
a weight unnamed.  
The candle flickers—  
a single flame  
stitching the dark  
to the edge of your breath’s hush.
